law.catch_line: Official documents, reproductions, and certified copies -- Use as evidence.

text.section: Upon the request of any person and payment of the applicable fee, the commissioner shall furnish a certified copy of any record or document in the department which is then subject to public inspection, as provided in subsection (3) of KRS 304.2-150.

Reproductions of records or documents on file in the department, when duly certified by the commissioner, shall be received in evidence in all proceedings and courts equally and in like manner as if they were the originals, and shall have the same effect and force as such originals, as in other cases provided by law or rule of court.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 933, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 2, sec. 17, effective June 18, 1970.
